title: LAWYER NAMED 'BORDER CZAR'
body:
U.S. Attorney Alan Bersin of San Diego has been named to the newly created post of "border czar," to oversee the 
array of law enforcement agencies along the U.S.-Mexico border, Justice Department officials said Friday.

While remaining the top U.S. prosecutor in San Diego, Bersin, 48, will report directly to U.S. Attorney General Janet 
Reno and coordinate multi-agency projects, such as using the FBI to target immigrant smuggling as organized 
crime and reorganizing inspections by the Immigration and Naturalization Service.
